medical_history.chief_complaint: Pain and swelling of the feet and ankles associated with a rash on lower extremities.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began a few days earlier with an achy sensation in the feet, progressing to difficulty in walking and a 'shuffling' gait. Painful red bumps developed on the lower extremities, and swelling was noted. The rash started on the dorsum of the foot and extended up the legs. Additionally, the patient experienced low-grade fever, migratory polyarthralgia, and intermittent nonbloody loose stools. Symptoms were aggravated by walking.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of asthma diagnosed clinically during childhood and presumptive irritable bowel syndrome diagnosed several months earlier.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had rheumatoid arthritis; no family history of inflammatory bowel disease.
medical_history.social_history: Lives in a western Massachusetts suburb with her husband and two dogs. No children; two first-trimester spontaneous abortions. Does not smoke or use intravenous drugs, and consumes an average of four glasses of wine per week. Travel history includes trips to the Caribbean and other regions without extensive exposure to soil.
